title: Stablecoin TerraUSD Continues Downward Spiral; Bitcoin Gains
sub_head: Blockchain underlying TerraUSD and sister token Luna has been halted twice
body:
The largest cryptocurrencies showed signs of recovery following a roughly weeklong selloff, while beleaguered stablecoin TerraUSD continued to tumble.
Bitcoin was up 7.2% Friday from its 5 p.m. ET level Thursday, trading at $30,640.14, after falling below $26,000 Thursday. Ether, the second-largest cryptocurrency by market value, rose 9.9%.
